message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with action classification in still images using sentence descriptions as weak labels. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-categories. The paper also proposes a two-stage learning process, which involves learning an Action Concept Tree (ACT) and an Action Semantic Alignment (ASA) model, indicating that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses a dataset for the task of learning actions from descriptions, suggesting that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
